title: What do you say when people ask 'What kind of music do you listen to?' if you don't really like music? - Quora

response.answer_text: “What do you say when people ask "What kind of music do you listen to?" if you don't really like music?” …..maybe something like, “…yeah, I’m just not really into music. It’s not my thing, so honestly I have no opinion on it.” ….or you could invent some big fantastic lie about childhood trauma that resulted in the inability to hear differences in tone, making all sounds equal, and therefore all music is lost on you anyway because all you can hear is rhythm and volume changes, and you could then expand upon how sad it makes because your mother(God rest her soul) used to sing you this specific nursery rhyme, and now you can’t even imagine it anymore(“…it’s gone, right there on the edge of memory, where I can almost reach out and touch it, but gone, gone I tell you, gone!”), and late at night when you can’t sleep, and you’re alone with the crickets and ticking of the clock, the reminder of this tortures your soul, and it is then that the tears come, and you know the breakdown is upon you, but there’s nothing you can do about it…. …yeah, just stick to being honest, seems far more simple in the long run.
